WorkItem.ClosedComment: Unable to duplicate even in 2.3.8 release code.
WorkItem.Description: In the fury module, rawr suggested certain slots with ArP gems and other slots with Str gems, which seems inconsistent - i.e. given the same pieces, either ArP or Str should be suggested for both.  I then looked at the graph and got even crazier results.  The only stat that seems correct is expertise.
WorkItem.Summary: [DPSWarr] Stat increment providing inconsistent dps increase

Comments.Message: Please add your char file as well
Some quick questions (as we do not yet have a character file to look at): Do you have Flooring enabled?  Is your character near the Crit cap?
Definitely interesting.  Yes, please attach your saved character xml file, I haven't seen anything like this before.
Is this still an issue in 2.3.9?
Adding the xml file used to generate that graph.
I will check it in 2.3.9 today.
The graph seems normal in 2.3.9 with consistent gem recommendations throughout.

Opened your file and the issue does not persist



** Closed by Jothay 2/16/2010 1:58 PM
Re-opening, because even though the bug doesn't occur in 2.3.9, that doesn't mean a bug doesn't still exist elsewhere.  I can't explain this being fixed by our checkins

Okay, I've looked at this some more, and I can't duplicate the behavior you're seeing in Rawr 2.3.8 -- my stat graph looks like the attached (WhatEbsSees).  That's the iteration issue that I did fix.

I'm wondering if you still see your crazy graph if you re-ran Rawr 2.3.8 again (if it was a weird threading issue, we've seen things like that before but they're impossible to track down)
